names.pinyin: gui zhi jia ge gen tang

actions: Releases the exterior, adjusts the Ying and Wei, warms the channels and collaterals to relieve pain, disperses Cold, unblocks Yang, transforms Qi and releases the muscle layer.
With Bai Shao, harmonizes the Ying and Wei and warms and tonifies the Middle Jiao.
Astringes the Yin and adjusts the Ying and Wei.
Helps release the exterior, treats nausea and vomiting. strengthens the spreading and mobilizing actions of the other herbs and adjusts the Ying and Wei.
With Zhi Gan Cao, harmonizes and regulates the Spleen and Stomach.
With Da Zao, regulates disharmony between the Ying and Wei. and benefits the Middle Qi.
Clears Heat, disperses Wind, releases the muscles (especially of the neck and upper back) and relieves sinus congestion.
Helps Bai Shao regulate the Ying and Wei.
With Gan Cao, tonifies and harmonizes the Middle Jiao .
Resolves Phlegm, stops cough, clears Heat and moderates and harmonizes the harsh properties of the other herbs.
Releases Wind-Cold from the muscle layer
syndromes: Wind-Cold Attacking the Exterior with Deficiency of Ying and Wei with neck and shoulder stiffness and pain
Tai Yang Zhong Feng with neck and shoulder stiffness and pain

symptoms: Fever and chills unrelieved by sweating
Muscles of the neck and back are very stiff and rigid
manifestations.pulse: Floating and moderate or floating and weak or slow

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Exterior Cold with Interior Heat.
Use caution during the summer or spells of hot weather.
Contraindicated for those with Wind-Cold without Ying Wei disharmony.

notes: Take hot porridge immediately after ingestion of formula.

modifications.purpose: cervical spondylosis with severe fixed pain
middle back pain with a Cold feeling
upper and middle back pain with a high fever and anhidrosis
middle back pain with coughing and white Phlegm
upper and middle back pain with a headache
